title: The historical works of Sir James Balfour.
author: Balfour, James
snippet: syres. Th'e Earle of Roxbrughe being therafter sentfrem courte, did conweine the counsaile at Linlithgow, the 7 of September, quher ther was ane declaratione for the- King, by oppin proclamatione at themercat erosse o£ Edinbrugh, shouing thai the KingesMaiestie doethe abhore all superstitions of poprie-,and wiolatione of the laudable lawes of the kingdome ;and ihe supplicants wer desyred by ihe Earle of Roxbrughe and Traquair, Thesaurer, not te appeire atLinlithgow, wnder promisse thai ther supplicationeshould be judicially hard in counsaile the nixt weeketherafter, to the wich ihe counsaile wes appoyntedto sitt at Dalkeithe ; wher the commissioners and diuersse wther noblemen of good sorte, did attend thecounsell to haue beine hard, bot wer pestpenit iUlthe 21 ef December. After this relatione, he subsumed -svpon ihe proclamatione, thai thinges cemplined one wer superstitious, full of poprie and superstitione, and wiolationeof the lawes of the kingdome, quherwpon he groundit the supplicants confidence, te assist aganist iheeiuells and the manteiners therof, seing his Maiestie, by proclamation, was cleired frem authorizingthe same.

title: The historical works of Sir James Balfour.
author: Balfour, James
snippet: Greinwitch^the 28 of Junij, 1638. No souner was ihe proclamatione endit, bot lohncjEarle of Cassiles, in name ef the noblemen ; MrAlexander Gibsone, younger of Durie, in name ofthe barrens ; lames Fletcher, prouest of Dundie, inname of the burrowes ; Mr Jo: Ker^ at Sallpeston,in name of the ministers ; and Mr Archbald lohn-ston, reider of ihe protesiatione, (wich from a scafsold neir the crosse, to that purpois rerected)- inname of all quho did adhere tb the confessione offaithe and couenant laitly renewed, tooke instruments in the handes of three noitaries present, atthe said crosse of Edinbrugh, being enwironed withnumbers of noblemen, barrens, &c. befor maneyhundreds of wittnesses ; and craued the extracteiherof : and in tokin of ther deuiifuU respecte io hisMaiestie, confidence of ihe equity of ther causse,and innoceneey of ther carriage, and houpe of hisMaiesties gratious acceptance, they offred, in all hu-milty, with submisse reuerence, a copey of ther said

title: The historical works of Sir James Balfour.
author: Balfour, James
snippet: The 28 day of this mounthe, the parliament enditand read, at wich solemity the Marquesse ef Douglas did beare the croune, Rothes ihe scepter, andEglintone the suord, from the parliament housseto the palace of Holyrudhousse, befor his Maiestie. The 1 of Julij, this zeire, his Maiesty continewedhis progresse from Edinbrugh to Linlithgow, quherhe stayed one night, from thence to Stirling, tuonights ; one Thursday he came to Dumfermling,the place of his birth, and from thence to Falklandand to Perth, quher he was magnificently feasted,with all his courte, by George, Earle of Kinnoule,Lord Chanceler of Scotland. From Perth, his Maiestie returned tuo nights io Falkland, quher he hadbeine formerlie three.

title: The historical works of Sir James Balfour.
author: Balfour, James
snippet: SCOTLAND. 223wyffe to Thomas, Lord Binninge, eldest soiie ioThomas, Earle of Hadingtone, Lord Priuey Seall,departed this lyffe at Edinbrugh, 5 Februarij, thiszeire, and was interred at Tininghame, the feurt ofMarche, 1635. WiUiam Keth, Earle Marishall of Scotland, departed ihis lyffe at his castle of Dunnoiyre, 28 ofOctober, 1635, aboute the 50 zeire of his age ; andwas solemley interrid amongest his aniecessers inthe church ther, the 26 of December, this samezeire.

title: The historical works of Sir James Balfour.
author: Balfour, James
snippet: In the mounthe of Appryle, this zeire, AlexanderMac-loyde, brother to Mac-loyd of Harries, didapprehend 4 of the principall rebells of the Lewis ;and was sumond to exhibit them wnder the paine oftressone, befor the Lordes of hes M,a'"'^ priuey counsaUl, befor he wold doe it. One Monday the 6 of Maij, this zeire, ther was aproclamatione at Edinbrugh crosse, discharging thecoursse and passage of all and quhatsomeuer coopercoyne, except the proper coyne of this kingdome,

title: The historical works of Sir James Balfour.
author: Balfour, James
snippet: Lykwayes, myLordes, (said he) I must requyre you to be wereycairfuU and circumspecte, ihat in thesse troubelsometymes, no order nor decree may passe frem you,wich may be prffiiudiciall to his Maiesties croune orseruice. The 8 of Julij, his Maiesties Commissioner causedsolemlie preclaime ihe Kings declaration (or a proclamatione of his fauor and grace, as in his auenletter he named it,) at the crosse of Edinbrugh,quherin his Maiestie declairs himselue to be free ofaney staine of poprey, that he wUl manteine thereligion presently professed within ihe kingdome,without aney innouatione: Thai he walde not, inaney tyme heirafter, euer wrge his subiects with thepractisse of the seruice booke, booke of canons, oreaney thing ef that nature : That he wold not makeaney alteration ather in lawes ore gouerniment;

title: The historical works of Sir James Balfour.
author: Balfour, James
snippet: As 58 Ja: 6, et Sal: 1624. In Julij this Zeire, 1624, by his Maiesties especialleommandiment, a proclamatione was publisht at themercat crosse of Edinbrugh, inhibitting all conwen-tickells, and priuey meittinges in housses by night,for deuotiene, wich is the only introducer of schisime,'and all sortes of damnable heresies in Godeschurche. I did almost forgett, how, one the 25 day of Maij,this same zeire,' the toune of Dumfermling, in Fyffeshyre, was in foure houres space burnid.

title: The historical works of Sir James Balfour.
author: Balfour, James
snippet: And te ther places wer admitted,Sr James Skeene to be Lord President? Sr Alexander Seatton of Gilcreuche ;Sr George Authenleck of Balmanno ;Sr Alexander Naper of Loureston ;Sr Archbald Acheson ef Glencarney ;Sr Robert Spotswood;Mr James Bellenden, Comissarey of Edinbrugh rMr Alexander Morisene of Prestongrange. As for the eighte ordinarey Lordes that werecontinued, viz.

title: The historical works of Sir James Balfour.
author: Balfour, James
snippet: A. D. 1639. from Dalkeithe ihey brought the royall enseingesof the kingdome, croune, suord and scepter, andthat with grate solemnity and pompe, and put themwpe in Edinbrugh castle, one Saterday ai night,that same day. The 20 ef Marche, this same zeire, the castell ofDouglas was randred io the couenanters.
